edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.client.Controllers

Class JavaClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.client.Controllers.JavaClient

  • public class JavaClient
extends java.lang.Object
    JavaClient is the main runnable client-side application, it allows users to connect to a server on a specific port and chat with other connected users, as well as play games like tic tac toe, gomoku, and chess with them it is composed of a user list, a message box, input box and send button for chatting, and a panel area to display the lobby or current game
    Version:
    for CS56, Fall 2017
    Author:
    Hong Wang, David Roster

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeLocation(int L)
      changes the location of the client, in order to generate a service panel associated with that location to start interacting with the specified service
      void connect(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      connect is called when the player enters an IP and port number, and clicks connect it attempts to connect the player to the associated running server if it exists
      java.util.ArrayList<ClientModel> getClients() 
      int getId() 
      ClientViewPanel getView() 
      void handleMessage(java.lang.String string)
      handleMessage is passed a string which has been sent from the server it attempts to resolve the request but may forward it to the active game panel, if applicable it manages things like users connecting, disconnecting, receiving private messages, nick changes, etc whereas the game panel handles data regarding the current game
      void init()
      Creates three new ArrayLists to SetClients, services, and messages.
      boolean isConnected() 
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void sendMessage(java.lang.String string)
      sends a message to the server, which might be a request for information, game data, or a literal message to be broadcast to all users in the message box
      void setClients(java.util.ArrayList<ClientModel> clients) 
      void setConnected(boolean connected) 
      void setId(int id) 
      void updateClients()
      updateClients updates the client list with the names and locations of everyone on the server should be called whenever a user joins, leaves, or changes locations
      void updateMessages()
      updateMessages updates the message box, and then scrolls down to the bottom to see the most recent message.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • init

        public void init()
        Creates three new ArrayLists to SetClients, services, and messages.

      • updateClients

        public void updateClients()
        updateClients updates the client list with the names and locations of everyone on the server should be called whenever a user joins, leaves, or changes locations

      • updateMessages

        public void updateMessages()
        updateMessages updates the message box, and then scrolls down to the bottom to see the most recent message. should be called whenever a new message is received

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String ip,
                    int port)
        connect is called when the player enters an IP and port number, and clicks connect it attempts to connect the player to the associated running server if it exists
        Parameters:
        ip - - the ip address string to connect to
        port - - the port number

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(java.lang.String string)
        handleMessage is passed a string which has been sent from the server it attempts to resolve the request but may forward it to the active game panel, if applicable it manages things like users connecting, disconnecting, receiving private messages, nick changes, etc whereas the game panel handles data regarding the current game
        Parameters:
        string - the data from the server to handle

      • changeLocation

        public void changeLocation(int L)
        changes the location of the client, in order to generate a service panel associated with that location to start interacting with the specified service
        Parameters:
        L - the service id number

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String string)
        sends a message to the server, which might be a request for information, game data, or a literal message to be broadcast to all users in the message box
        Parameters:
        string - a string of data to send to the server
